p: Taxonomically, the family Hepeviridae is divided into the genus Orthohepevirus with the species Orthohepevirus A, B, C, and D, and the genus Piscihepevirus. The species Orthohepevirus A contains eight distinct genotypes that infect humans and other mammals [ 10]. It is known that HEV-1 to -4 infect humans, and rare cases of human infection with other genotypes like HEV-7 have also been described [ 11, 143].
